intro: Cissus decaryi, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible fig-like fruits. Cissus decaryi thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocks or trees in its natural habitat. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
